p: The responses of B. pilosa and E. crus-galli between untreated and treated by P. cubeba or P. nigrum EOs in the proline accumulations were indicated in Figure 6. In the roots, effects of P. cubeba and P. nigrum EOs in proline accumulation of the two indicator plants were negligible compared with control. In contrast, in the aerial parts proline accumulations between control and treated indicator plants were significantly different. Compare with P. nigrum, P. cubeba EO stimulated 16.23 and 18.08% higher in proline accumulations of B. pilosa and E. crus-galli respectively.
